This app is designed for new moms and moms-to-be, making breast pumping easier, more comfortable, and more efficient.This app helps mothers save time, manage health better, and enjoy peace of mind throughout their breastfeeding journey.

Discover one of the top pregnancy tracker apps designed specifically for women and expecting parents. This application will keep you calm throughout your pregnancy, providing daily insights into your baby's development and your own health. It will let you know what’s happening with you and your unborn baby—week after week—and offer guidance on how to handle new situations. New, helpful articles are posted every day to support your pregnancy journey!




Keep track of your weight, blood pressure, tummy growth, baby's first movements, and contractions with our advanced tracking tools. Save all your important data in a single, easy-to-share report for your doctor, ensuring your pregnancy progress is well-documented.


May your pregnancy be pleasant and wonderful! Our app provides the tools and resources expecting parents need to feel confident and prepared.



The Most Interesting Features of the App:
- Convenient Calendar: Schedule tests and doctor visits effortlessly.  

- Pregnancy Diary: Use this tracker to log your weight, tummy size, blood pressure, mood, and sexual activity daily. Never miss appointments or key tests.  

- Weekly Baby Development Updates: Find out when your baby becomes the size of a grapefruit, grows eyelashes, or when you can discover their gender. Get nutritional and lifestyle advice tailored for women and their babies.  

- Daily Articles: Access a wealth of resources and tools with professional advice to help women navigate emotions, relationships, and health during pregnancy.  

- Doctor Report: Compile all your tracking data into a comprehensive report, available as a PDF or on your phone, to share with your doctor.  

- Checklists and To-Do Lists: Stay organized with trimester-specific checklists and to-do lists—perfect for expecting parents.  

- Smart Gestational Age Calculator: Trusted by top medical professionals, this tool calculates fetal and obstetric terms with pinpoint accuracy.  

- Kegel Exercises: Prepare for childbirth with guided exercises, an essential tool for women’s health during pregnancy.  

- Contraction Counter: This intelligent tracker distinguishes real contractions from practice ones, ensuring you and your baby are ready for delivery.  

- Health App Synchronization: Securely save your pregnancy tracking data with seamless integration.


We’ve worked hard to create one of the best apps for expectant mothers. Send your feedback to team@wachanga.com (mailto:team@wachanga.com)—we’re here to support women and parents every step of the way.

This app is for pumping mummies who insist on breast milk feedings for babies.

You can time the pumping, track the time, duration and amount of each pump, monitor the freezer stash and estimate the days to reach your goal.

It’s easy and effective to help you stress relief on ‘When did I pump last time?’, ‘When should I pump next time?’, ‘How much did I produce recent days?’ and ‘When can I stop pumping?’ these staffs.

Key Features:
⁃ Time the pumping.
⁃ Add pumping log manually.
⁃ Track how much produced and how long pumped for each log.
⁃ Track pumping times and total volume for each day.
⁃ Track time and duration of each pump.
⁃ Monitor current freeze stash.
⁃ Custom baby’s consumption in different age group and weaning time.
⁃ Estimate days and date that you can drop pumping.
⁃ Custom reminders to alert pumping.
⁃ Report for daily freezer stash.
⁃ Report for daily pumping volume.
⁃ Export logs by email in format of PDF, CSV or HTML.
⁃ Dropbox backup and restore.
⁃ Passcode protection.
⁃ Supports Apple Watch version.
⁃ Supports universal version (available on both iPhone and iPad).

If you have any question, please email to linklinksapp@tom.com.

Understand Menstrual Cycle

The app contains:
What is menstruation 
What is the menstrual cycle 
What happens during the menstrual cycle 
What Normal Period & Ovulation Cycles Look Like 
How to Chart Your Cycle to Know When You Can Get Pregnant
Phases of Menstrual cycle - Friendly guide to healthy periods
What is a typical menstrual period 
Premenstrual syndrome 
What kinds of problems do women have with their periods
When does a girl usually get her period
How long does a woman have periods? 
How to take care of your period 
Periods problem and what to do 
Pregnancy and the Menstrual Cycle 
When you should see a doctor about your period

Our App contains general medical information.
The medical information is not advice and should not be treated as such.
The medical information on our App is provided without any representations or warranties, express or implied.
You must not rely on the information on our App as an alternative to medical advice from your doctor or other professional healthcare provider.
If you have any specific questions about any medical matter, you should consult your doctor or other professional healthcare provider.
If you think you may be suffering from any medical condition, you should seek immediate medical attention.
You should never delay seeking medical advice, disregard medical advice or discontinue medical treatment because of information on our App.
Our App includes interactive features that allow users to communicate with us.
You acknowledge that, because of the limited nature of communication through our App’s interactive features, any assistance you may receive using any such features is likely to be incomplete and may even be misleading.
Any assistance you may receive using any our App’s interactive features does not constitute specific advice and accordingly should not be relied upon without further independent confirmation.

Receive daily reminders to never forget your contraceptive pill again and have a peaceful and secure life.

With Pill Reminder, you will receive notifications in the form of customizable reminders, ensuring that you never forget to take your pill again.

See what your personal assistant can do for you:

Contraceptive pill reminder: Set the time you want to take your pill and customize the message you want to receive in your own way.
Record how you felt during the day: Did you experience mood changes, bleeding, or cramps? Record it in the app and check it whenever you want.
Calendar: Know which day of the month your break will be, have your menstrual calendar always at your fingertips, and schedule your menstrual cycle.
Pack history: All used packs are saved so you know when you missed taking the contraceptive pill, and you can check it whenever you want.
Reminder for a new pack: Receive an alert within the app reminding you to buy a new pack of contraceptive pills.
Compatible with all contraceptives: No matter what your combination is, you can use our app for free.
Assists in gynecological appointments: With all the information about your menstrual cycle at hand, easily report how your body behaved in your past menstrual cycles.

With Pill Reminder, you will have peace of mind and confidence in your contraceptive control. Enjoy the best app for contraceptive reminder and control.

The Pill Reminder app was created to contribute to women's health, assisting in contraceptive control through birth control pills. With a simple interface, easy configuration, and all features free of charge, it stands out. With it in hand, you will have your menstrual cycle monitoring, fertility tracking, and an alarm to remind you to take the pill.

You can plan your life through the menstrual calendar, where you can see when your period will come if your contraceptive has a break or inactive pills.

It has never been easier to keep your contraceptive up to date. Download it now for free!

Thanks to this complete app, you can make sure you take your birth control pill every day that you set up quickly and easily.

Don't forget to take your pill ever again!

Main features:
- Daily notifications: Set the time you want to be notified to take your pill. In addition, you can configure repetitions so that it will continue to notify you until you indicate that you?ve taken it.
- Customized to your liking: Fully configurable and customizable. It?s compatible with all types of birth control pills. Choose the number of days of taking active pills, days of placebo, and much more.

- Calendar: You?ll be able to see the complete calendar with all the pills that have been taken and all the upcoming doses in a visual and practical way.

Join the #1 Pregnancy & Baby Tracker App that’s Trusted by Millions for Week-by-Week Guidance and Baby Tracking Tools.

What to Expect is the world’s best-known baby development and growth tracker app chosen by more than 15 million parents. We’re the parenting, infant and family planning brand, offering you a free all-in-one pregnancy and baby tracker app with thousands of medically accurate articles, daily pregnancy updates, expert baby growth tracking, and personalized parenting tips to help you nurture a healthy pregnancy, a thriving baby, and confident parenting.

Find guides for every step of your growing family’s journey—from starting a family and recognizing early signs of pregnancy to navigating motherhood, newborn care, and the baby and toddler years. Find support and connection with moms, parents, and parents-to-be throughout your pregnancy journey.

During Pregnancy

* Due Date Calculator that determines your due date based on last period, IVF transfer, conception, and ultrasound, while sharing fun facts about your baby
* Week-by-week pregnancy tracker with info about baby development, symptoms and family preparation tips
* Themed baby size comparisons, visual countdown and 3D videos showing baby development in utero week by week of pregnancy
* Helpful daily tips designed to support you at every stage
* Keep track of your bump, symptoms, pregnancy weight, kick counts, birth plan and memories with our My Journal tool
* Expert-reviewed articles on signs of labor, pregnancy symptoms, baby and mom’s health and helpful tips
* Registry Builder to help you with your baby list and registry
* Detailed pregnancy and baby product reviews and expert buying guides
* Expecting Twins? Learn about different types of twins and possible fetal positions
* Use the contractions counter to track the frequency and duration of contractions

After Baby’s Arrival

* Baby Tracker that lets you time and track baby’s feedings, log pump sessions, diaper changes, tummy time, and more
* Month-by-month and milestone tracker for each step of your baby’s life, from the newborn to the toddler stage
* Daily tips tailored  to your baby’s age, stage, your postpartum recovery, and your parenting journey
* Record your postpartum symptoms and medications 
* Informative videos and articles about sleep schedules, feeding tips, milestones, and baby’s growth and week-by-week development
* Medically reviewed articles and info about baby’s health, doctor’s appointments and vaccines
* Join community groups meet people with due dates in the same month, newborn care, mom’s health conditions, parenting styles and more

Family Planning

* Ovulation Calculator that pinpoints your most fertile days based on last period and cycle
* Due Date Calculator that helps you figure out baby’s potential due date when you’re trying to conceive (TTC)
* Ovulation tracker and early pregnancy signs, plus keep a journal of your feelings when you’re trying to get pregnant
* Expert advice and articles to help you understand your cycle, signs of ovulation and pregnancy, fertility issues, adoption and surrogacy, and more
* Community groups devoted to preparing for pregnancy and fertility treatments

About Us 

All content on the What to Expect app is accurate, up-to-date, and reviewed by medical experts, including the What to Expect Medical Review Board. It aligns with current health guidelines and Heidi Murkoff’s trusted books 

Medical information comes from expert sources like ACOG, AAP, CDC, and peer-reviewed journals to ensure reliability and credibility.

For more about What to Expect's medical review and editorial policy, visit: https://www.whattoexpect.com/medical-review/
Do not sell my info: https://dsar.whattoexpect.com/

Use our pregnancy tracker app to help nurture a happy, healthy pregnancy & baby! Let’s connect:
* Instagram: @whattoexpect
* Twitter: @WhatToExpect
* Facebook: facebook.com/whattoexpect
* Pinterest: pinterest.com/whattoexpect
* TikTok: @whattoexpect

The American Heart Association’s Full Code Pro (FCP 3.4) is a free, easy-to-use, mobile app that allows you to quickly document critical interventions during cardiac arrest resuscitation events. This app lets you focus on the patient without sacrificing proper documentation.

FCP 3.4 includes a user controlled metronome with an adjustable rate between 100 and 120 bpm.  Now you can use FCP to check your CPR rate performance.

Using this real-time app to log your actions, you can improve the availability and accuracy of documentation of a resuscitation event. This gives you more robust data for review, debriefing and resuscitation quality improvement. FCP 3.3 has a customizable drug list, pre-populated with common cardiac arrest drugs. It also includes lists of common events and rhythms.

It is highly recommended that you back up all of your log files in your database and remove older versions of FCP before installing this new version. All log files and data from version 2.O and 2.2 will NOT transfer to Version 3.4

FCP 3.4 is for use by paramedics, EMT-Bs, emergency room nurses, emergency room physicians and other in- and out-of-hospital healthcare providers.

Ezzycare is a novel medical solution to the challenges of both healthcare providers and healthcare seekers. It connects health care seekers to the closest providers in their vicinity using their geo location similar to how Uber cab connects drivers to riders. Healthcare seekers pay providers via this platform. It solves the ever present challenge of getting service in an easy and convenient way. Health care providers decide their charges for various services.  

Highlights :
• Urgent and non-urgent consultations with Doctors of various specialties via video 
calls. 
• Urgent and non-urgent home and clinic visits between Doctors and care seekers. 
• Home visit by nearby nurses, Physiotherapists and massage therapists at the 
convenience of cares seekers. 
• Drug orders from pharmacists and home delivery of drugs. 
• Tracking of drug orders made to pharmacists in real time. 
• Care seekers can request Laboratory tests from anywhere and nearby scientists and pathologists can visit to carry out tests. 
• Care seekers can order various radiological tests like scans and get nearby 
radiologists and radiographers to do the tests. 
• All health care services can be requested on behalf of other people from anywhere.

MDCalc is the leading clinical decision support app providing 900+ evidence-based calculators, risk scores, and clinical tools to support patient care at the bedside. MDCalc has been trusted by millions of clinicians since 2005.

Why Clinicians Choose MDCalc:

• Created by Physicians, for Physicians - All tools developed and validated by board-certified physicians  
• 900+ Clinical Tools - Risk scores, algorithms, dosing calculators, and more with consistent updates and new tools added regularly 
• Works Offline - Full functionality without internet connection  
• Evidence-Based - Every tool includes research validation and expert commentary  
• CME Tracking - Earn CME just by reading through the clinical content surrounding many of our tools
• Free Registration - Complete access in under 30 seconds  

Key Features:

Smart Search & Organization
• Quick search across all tools
• Customizable favorites and specialty lists
• Recently used tools for quick access
• Auto-sync between web and mobile
• Explore page for personalized suggestions

Clinical Expertise
• Expert insights from creators
• Pearls & pitfalls from specialists
• Evidence summaries with PubMed links
• Error warnings and normal value ranges

Workflow Support
• Toggle between US and SI units instantly
• Works in limited connectivity settings
• Easy to use at the point-of-care

Popular Tools Include:
• Creatinine Clearance - Cockcroft-Gault Equation
• HA2DS2-VASc Score - Atrial Fibrillation Stroke Risk
• HEART Score- Major Cardiac Events
• Wells' Criteria - Pulmonary Embolism & DVT
• MELD Score - End-Stage Liver Disease
• HAS-BLED Score - Major Bleeding Risk
• SIRS/Sepsis Criteria - Septic Shock Assessment
• Mean Arterial Pressure - Hemodynamic Monitoring


MDCalc ensures only the highest-quality, clinically relevant tools make it into the app. Each calculator undergoes rigorous evidence appraisal and validation by our network of academic and practicing physician experts.

description:
Pregnant? Get the free app for expectant parents to track how their baby is growing 

amma Pregnancy Calendar is an indispensable tool for expectant mothers! Get detailed information on the development of your baby at each week of pregnancy. Hundreds of thousands of women have already chosen to use this app, so join them, and us, on this incredible journey!

With amma Pregnancy Calendar you can easily:
- Get DAILY pregnancy info
- Track your pregnancy week-by-week over the 9 months 
- Get baby size information and development updates weekly
- Get information on changes in your body flow
- Manage weight and belly growth gain goals with clinical guidelines for your BMI
- Track contractions and send results to a medic with Contraction Timer
- Pregnancy+ Weight log
- Track baby kicks with Kick Counter
- Get more information about the weekly expectations of pregnancy 
- Share on Facebook, Email, Text & Twitter
- Personal Diary

and much more

Every woman who is expecting a child, is preparing herself for giving birth. Naturally, she will want to know how her baby is developing, what is happening to her body and what other changes are awaiting her until the birth. In this application, you will find a detailed weekly pregnancy calendar giving you ease of access to information about pregnancy and fetal development, changes in a pregnant woman's body, as well as tips on nutrition for pregnant women. For each week of pregnancy, there are four pieces of information: 
•	Baby development,
•	Mother’s body,
•	Mom’s meals,
•	Useful tips.
To use the pregnancy calendar, and count your due date, simply enter the date of your last period and you should see the information about your duration of gestation

This App is not intended for medical use, or to replace the advice of a trained medical doctor. If you have any concerns about your pregnancy, consult with your doctor or midwife.

The Blood Pressure App is an intuitive and user-friendly blood pressure monitoring app designed to help you take charge of your cardiovascular health. Its easy-to-use interface and powerful features empower you to track, analyze, and manage your blood pressure with ease.

Data Entry After Measurement: 
Record your blood pressure measurements after each reading. You can input systolic, diastolic blood pressure, and pulse. The app also allows you to note pills, arrhythmia, and migraine.

Convenient Statistics: 
The App provides comprehensive and insightful statistics that help you understand your blood pressure trends over time. It generates clear, easy-to-read graphs and charts that display your blood pressure history, allowing you to spot patterns and changes at a glance. You can filter data by date ranges to track progress and share your results with your healthcare provider.

Daily Activity Logging: 
Beyond blood pressure monitoring, the app includes a feature for noting your overall well-being and daily activities. You can track factors like stress levels, physical activity, diet, and more. This information can provide valuable context for your blood pressure readings and help you identify lifestyle factors that may be impacting your health.

User-Friendly Interface: 
The app is designed for simplicity and ease of use, making it suitable for users of all ages.

Our Blood Pressure Monitor is your reliable companion in achieving better blood pressure management and a healthier lifestyle. Take control of your heart health and start your journey toward optimal well-being with this powerful and convenient app.

Good health to you!

Terms of use: https://www.apple.com/legal/internet-services/itunes/dev/stdeula

My Baby Heart Sounds is a quick and easy way to use your iPhone to listen, record and share your baby's heart sounds.

Not too long ago, we were pregnant mothers too. While our partners enjoyed listening to our babies' sounds by placing their ears on the tummy, we wanted to capture and share these precious audio-memories ourselves. We tried voice memo apps and other sound-recording apps but felt that there was something more we could do to improve the quality of the sound in a simple setup. Fast forward a couple years and here we are!

Why should you try this app?

- Minimum time to setup. All you need is your iPhone. Simple instructions are provided within the app and we are here to support you all the way.
- High quality sound. Using advanced audio signal processing techniques, we deliver a high quality audio experience that allows you to distinguish your baby's heart sounds. For best results use AirPods.
- Listen for free and only pay when you want to record and share.
- Secure. All recordings are stored on your phone. We do not have any access to your recordings. You decide how you would like to share your recordings.
- Track your pregnancy journey. Get weekly insights on pregnancy symptoms, learn how to read ultrasound scans, monitor contractions, and keep track of your baby’s movements with a kick counter.

For best results:

- Use the app when you are 20-30 weeks or greater pregnant.
- Use the app in a quiet room
- Remove any phone case/shell/cover (the iPhone needs to touch your skin to be able to pick up the sounds)
- Put the phone in Airplane Mode
- Start the app and place the iPhone on your tummy to listen for a clear sound. You may need to try a few different spots. Press "Record" to create a recording
- Use AirPods

My Baby Heart Sounds Disclaimer:

- The My Baby Heart Sounds app is NOT a Medical Device or application. It is NOT in any way suitable for medical opinion, advice or diagnosis, and it is NOT intended to provide any information about the person of use's wellbeing or health.
- The app does NOT backup recordings automatically outside the user's device. It is the user's responsibility to regularly backup their recordings.

Subscribe to access to premium app features; subscription details are the following:

- Length: weekly, yearly
- Your payment will be charged to your iTunes Account as soon as you confirm your purchase
- You can manage your subscriptions and turn off auto-renewal from your Account Settings after the purchase

The application is based on the scientific research. It helps to determine the fertile days of the month, so you can either achieve or avoid pregnancy. The application uses the date of the last period and shows the date of the next period, the best days to conceive a baby, the ovulation day and when you can avoid pregnancy.

* Scientific Research *

The popular baby gender prediction method is used by default. But it’s based only on the widely-spread theory by Landrum Shettles. The application also supports the scientific baby gender prediction method. It’s based on the scientific research by Rodrigo Guerrero and the statistics of thousands of women.

You can change the gender prediction method on the “Settings” screen. But remember that either gender prediction method shows only slightly higher chances of conceiving a girl or a boy and it never guarantees the result.

* Full Version *

This is the full version of the application. You will be able to see the following data:

- The probability of getting pregnant on the current or on any selected day.
- The probability of conceiving a girl or a boy using the selected gender prediction method.
- Chances of getting pregnant during the current period.
- Chances of conceiving a girl or a boy during the current period.

* How to Use *

To generate the menstrual calendar you have to provide the following data:

- The first day of the last cycle (select the day and use the button “Add”).
- Average length of the menstrual cycle (adjust it on the “Settings” screen).
- Length of the luteal phase (most women can use the default value).

The application works best for women with regular menstrual cycle. But average cycle length is also a good way to predict when the ovulation should happen.

At Ovia Health by Labcorp, we’re here to empower women at every stage of their health journey—from your period through fertility, pregnancy, postpartum, perimenopause, menopause, and beyond.    With personalized tools and data-driven insights, Ovia empowers women to make informed decisions and access the care they need, whenever they need it.
Whether you're tracking your period, trying to get pregnant, monitoring your pregnancy, recovering postpartum, navigating perimenopause, or tracking your health, join millions of Ovia users.

Consistently rated one of the best women’s health apps, Ovia helps you stay on top of all your women’s health needs – in one trusted place!

◆ Perimenopause & Menopause support - comprehensive health tracking for real-time alerts & personalized feedback.

OVULATION CALCULATOR & FERTILITY TRACKER
◆ Fertile window and ovulation time predictions & a daily fertility score. An ovulation app that helps you know when you’re ovulating when trying to conceive (TTC).

STAY UP TO DATE ON YOUR PREGNANCY WITH ESSENTIALS

◆ Pregnancy Tracker & Baby Growth Calendar: Compare your baby’s weekly size to a fruit, toy, pastry item, or animal. View 3D illustrations of your baby each week & track baby’s growth.

Regarded as the gold standard of medicines information and clinical management protocols in South Africa, the South African Medicines Formulary (SAMF), first published in 1988, is a trusted source of information and provides up-to-date, reliable, unbiased and evaluated information on medicines. 
Currently on its 15th edition , it has become a standard health practitioner's medicine reference guide, respected for accuracy of content and independence from the pharmaceutical industry. It is now available on this mobile application and supported by a web portal (https://samf-app.com/) which subscribers will have access to.

The SAMF application and Book is a joint initiative of the Division of Clinical Pharmacology at the University of Cape Town and the South African Medical Association (SAMA). Liquid thought maintains the application and web portal.
To find information on each of the entities :
- Medicines Information Centre, Division of Clinical Pharmacology at the University of Cape Town: http://www.mic.uct.ac.za
- South African Medical Association: https://www.samedical.org
- Liquid thought: https://www.liquidthought.co.za

All content provided in the Platform is for informational, educational and assistive purposes only, and is not a substitute for the professional judgement of healthcare professionals diagnosing and treating patients. UCT and SAMA do not provide medical advice or medical or diagnostic services through the Platform. Any reliance on the content obtained on or through the Platform is at your own risk.

SAMF Citation:
-  Division of Clinical Pharmacology, Faculty of Health Sciences. (2024). South African Medicines Formulary (SAMF). SAMF website. https://samf-app.com 

Get access to SAMF app content with an in-app purchase.

- 1 month subscription costs R93.99 (Prices may vary slightly depending on location)
- 1 year subscription costs R929.99 (Prices may vary slightly depending on location)

Payment will be made at the time of purchase confirmation via your App Store account
The subscription will be automatically extended if you do not switch off the automatic renewal at least 24 hours before the premium membership expires

Developed by doctors, MedShr is the easiest and safest way for medical professionals to discover, discuss and share clinical cases and medical images. Join our community and connect with hundreds of thousands of verified doctors, healthcare professionals and medical students sharing knowledge and learning from each other in a secure private network.

MedShr’s Awards include: Facebook App of the Year for Social Good Award; The Evening Standard Startup of the Year 2018; and a World Summit Award from the United Nations.

The app has been featured on the BBC, Sky News, The Evening Standard, The Telegraph and Metro News.

“A revolution in the way Medical Knowledge spreads” *****
- Dr Tzalamouras Basilis, Interventional Cardiology Fellow

DISCOVER AND DISCUSS MEDICAL CASES & IMAGES

From ECGs, scans and X-rays to patient photos and videos, MedShr helps you find and discuss relevant medical cases with colleagues, by specialty and at all grades. MedShr is a totally secure, private network and features an easy to use in-app patient consent form and system for anonymising images. Follow clinical cases you find interesting and learn from your peers with informal and accredited case based discussion.

SHARE KNOWLEDGE WITH VERIFIED MEMBERS

MedShr is the simple way to capture, share and discuss clinical images and videos in your everyday practice. Create a case, obtain consent and start a discussion securely from your mobile. Send medical cases to colleagues, share them with the wider community, export to your e-portfolio or simply organise cases for your personal records. MedShr is safe, secure and enables you to maintain complete control over the privacy of your cases - with all members being 100% verified as doctors, healthcare professionals and medical students.

EXPAND YOUR PROFESSIONAL NETWORK

Medical students and doctors of all levels are joining MedShr to advance their learning as they connect with peers from their university, place of work and across the world. Connect and follow specialists in your field to keep up to date on their latest cases, techniques and learnings. Join groups to learn from others, share findings or just converse around complex and interesting clinical cases. Medical students, junior doctors and specialist trainees use MedShr groups as a resource for informal learning, ahead of case-based examinations and as an aid to formal learning.

MESSAGE CONNECTIONS AND COLLEAGUES

MedShr Messaging allows you to message your connections about anything from arranging to meet at a conference to sharing a link to an interesting case. To get started, tap the message bubble in the top right-hand corner of the home feed to start a new chat. Use MedShr Messaging to reach out to colleagues and build your network.

OBTAIN CPD CREDITS AND SHOW PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT

There are opportunities to learn from and reflect on cases every day. MedShr now makes it easy to request Continuing Professional Development (CPD) credits for each case that you share on MedShr. The simple process makes it easy to receive CPD credit and keep a record of your learning on the go.

HELP MAKE A DIFFERENCE TO THOSE IN NEED

Our community is providing medics in crisis zones and doctors in developing countries with quick access to second and specialist medical opinions so that they can make critical clinical decisions. With your participation, you can collaborate with like-minded professionals and be part of a new frontier in medical education.

“MedShr is a brilliant idea - smartphones connect doctors, making it possible for aid workers to get an instant medical diagnosis” ***** - Rohan Silver, Evening Standard

For support, suggestions and feedback, please contact us at info@medshr.net
